												I got this FREE game the day it came out, as i'm a big fan of pool games. Alas, it leaves much to be desired, based on the version up to and including the patch on 16th March. See below:PROS:- It's fun enough to play while watching the telly, for a time, and if you've nothing else to do.- It's free.CONS:- Extremely derivative: It's a pool game clone, and a poor one at that. It is outdone, not only by the majority of browser-based pool games, but also by the likes of Arcade Pool for the Amiga, which is now over 20 years old.- Putting spin on the ball has barely any effect whasoever. This needs to be ramped up significantly. I enjoy playing pool, though i consider myself an amateur, and even i can put triple the amount of spin on the cue ball as this game allows. As such, many shots which would be easy enough in real life (and most other pool games) are impossible here.- Only one mode of play: 8-Ball- Poor matchmaking, which can mean waiting forever for a game, even when there was an odd number of people in the sparsely-populated rooms. I've left it running for about 8 minutes without getting a game. However, exiting out of the room and rejoining seemingly got me a game much quicker than just waiting in the queue, indicating a glitch.- The "hit boxes" for the balls are clearly some way off. It is possible to hit an opponents ball when, very clearly, you should have hit your own ball first.- Although the latest patch states that you should "win" the game if your opponent disconnects, this isn't the case. I've lost my stake through no fault of my own because i've had to leave a game that my opponent disconnected from.- Sometimes, you can not pot any balls, and miraculously, it is your go again. Obviously, this is particularly annoying when it happens for your opponent.- The physics still need some work, even after 2 or 3 hotfixes.- The actual proper rules of 8-ball pool are not taken into consideration, e.g. at break-off, snookering behind a played balll without hitting a cushion/rail first.- Syncing issues which can cause you to lose time through no fault of your own.- Graphical glitching at the menu and room screens.I don't like writing reviews like this, but the fact of the matter is that this game is outdone by just about every other pool game available, and is at best a bare-bones pre-alpha. It could end up working, but at the minute, it isn't worth recommending, even for nothing. There are plenty of other, much more worthy, free, online multiplayer pool games out there that you could be playing.

												When I first saw the game, I automatically knew it would be a game that I would like! This game is a good pool simulator that will quickly grab your attention. Although, there are some cons about this game  that you really should know before getting this game.Most games have a way for you to practice the gameplay that you will come across while playing. When you think of this, you imagine a trainer that is going to go easy on you and you slowly start to get better as you continue! But no! Not this game! The practice mode isn't any easier than playing the regular game itself! In fact, it is probably harder than playing against a high-leveled player! The practice mode is pretty much just a computer with AimBot, and this bot perfectly makes every single shot without even taking more than 5 seconds to think! When I was doing the practice, I honestly began to wonder why these people even added a practice mode! I also wondered why this bot isn't at the top of the leaderboard... Not only that, but the practice mode always makes you hit the ball first, pretty much giving the bot a 95% chance to win without you even being able to do anything in the game! At that point, I wanted to repetitively bang my head against my desk!Shouldn't most games be able to connect you to a game or game lobby within a matter of seconds. Most games I know do that, but nooooooooo. Premium Pool not only has a huge problem connecting with other players to start a match, but it also has a problem staying connected. In order to get into a match, you have to pay coins, and if you lose connection, you also lose the coins! I was expecting to have an estimated 5-10 seconds to connect to a match, but this game can take 20 seconds up to a minute just to connect to a match with another player. I was able to go downstairs, pour myself a glass of water, drink it all, and successfully make it back to my computer before this game even connected to a match!You thought it ended there? I didn't mention this game has huge amounts of lag? You could hit the cue ball in the opposite dirrection of the hole, and a lag spike will bring the ball right back and give you another chance. This game crashes more than a 2 year old flying an RC Helicopter! I didn't even know it could get that bad...In conclusion... you will have an easier time getting a whale halfway across the earth than trying to play this game. Hopefully this helped you all! ;)

												This is more or a less a beta game.  But, its free so, that somewhat excuses some issues.  However, connectivity seems to be an issue.  Its rather difficult to connect to players in online mode.  Apparently that is being worked on by the devs.  You start off with 250 gold coins and you can purchase more through steam. At that rate, however, it will take quite a few games to purchase some of the low level items in the store.  As far as game play and the physics etc, its not bad.  The aiming lines help but, without them, making shots is nearly impossible without a lot of practice.....and I mean A LOT OF PRACTICE.  From what I can see, 8 Ball is the only game vairant available at this time.  I would rather have seen the game start off with 9 Ball.  But, that's really a matter of personal preference, I suppose.  Since the game is free, I will recommend it.  Its not a bad start to a game that has some decent, but, limited potential. 												4/30/2016 EDIT: I've come across yet another issue: every time I exit the game it freezes and I am forced to use the task manager to close the program. It isn't a game-breaking bug, but it's one of those small annoyances that still needs fixing.4/27/2016 EDIT: Recently I've come across another problem with this game: very frequent game freezes which usually results in me having to restart the game.(No, it is not my computer; my computer is brand new and has perfectly handled games much more sophisticated than this.) Another issue that has become increasingly common is that it is almost impossible for me to connect to the online play, so my only option is to play offline unless this fixes itself(which is very rare, despite me restarting the game several times.) I am aware that other people have connection issues with this game as well, based on other user reviews.ORIGINAL: While Premium Pool has many flaws and issues, I recommend Premium Pool despite these issues only because it is *free* and fun when the issues are not affecting your gameplay significantly. However, I do not recommend spending money on this game at all. Most(if not all) of the items purchased with real money are only for looks and cannot be profitted off of nor do they affect your performance in the game. Plus, I wouldn't spend money on this game due to some of the big issues the game has.Some of the issues I noticed in my first session playing Premium Pool:- It is nearly impossible to play against your steam friends, because the game always has trouble connecting.- Due to very few players actively online on Premium Pool, it is very common to be pinned against other players who are not anywhere near your own skill level. This can make it hard for new players by forcing them to play against the more experienced ones, and allow the more experienced players to money farm off of the newer players. This leaves the less experienced player with little to no cash left.- Lots of in-game purchases required to get almost all of the better stuff(a separate currency that can only be purchased with money is used to buy nearly all of the non-newbie gear.) However, this does not make the game pay to play. It works perfectly fine without making in-game purchases.- Looks very similar to many other "Pool" games all over the web with not much difference between Premium Pool and all the others.Pros:- Very fun when you get good matchmaking and don't get utterly decimated by an opponent 10 levels ahead of you.- Pretty easy to get the hang of this game, also a very relaxed and friendly environment.- Good community(from what I saw), for all the people I played against, I enjoyed menu chatting back and forth with them, especially with small taunts such as saying "Thanks." when they pot the cue ball.- Fun to play if you don't have enough time for more sophisticated games such as RPG's. The matches are fairly quick and a timer prevents players from taking too long on their shots.- Lots of cool looking cues, table designs, arenas and more.(Unfortunately though, most of them cost an in-game currency that can only be obtained by purchase.)I would personally recommend "8-Ball Pool" by Miniclip which can be found both online and on the App Store. It's basically this but stepped up about five levels with minigames, great matchmaking, easy multiplayer against friends & family and different cues & ranks that offer not only just cooler looks but more speed, power, and so on.I hope any readers take my review into consideration! :D

												Premium Pool Review – Raymond KTI like pool; I really do but games like this ruin the experience. The reason why I wouldn't recommend this game is that the game has some major bugs and ''glitches''. I and my friend found a bug that makes your opponent's time run out even if he shot the ball. The speed is terrible. Even with max speed the ball doesn't move that quickly as it should to actually hit bank shots. The game is copy of 8ball pool but the creators said that they are going to add new game modes such as 9ball. I know those glitches might not be glitches in your opinion but we tested the time runout glitch with 2 over 200mbps download and 50mbps upload nets with 5-7 ping. The ''bags'' you are hitting balls are WAYYYYY too big, seems like the game has box colliders. Just play “8 Ball Pool” by Miniclip instead, it’s a lot more worth it and you can find matches easier.It’s just a failed copy of 8 Ball Pool.Literally everything is copied from 8 ball pool, except one important thing: physics. It has the worst reality in every pool games i played. The balls go with a incredible speed and suddenly they stop in the middle of the table, the movements aren't real at al...Even if you shoot with medium force it stops in the middle of the target making you have to shoot with max force when it shouldn't be supposed to.Also the fact that the minimum value you have to play is 50 coins and you start with 250 coins makes you with short selection of choices when you start to play and , in a low quantity of games you can lose everything , even with the lowest entry possible. 												An example of a pay wall game done right.  While I don't think it's that groundbreaking of a game, it doesn't stop you from playing after a while, forcing you to pay to continue, which I can appreciate.  You CAN buy things in game with real money if you're impatient, but you can also EARN coins in game to do the same.What else i there to say other than the classic game of pool has never been better.  Sadly, I do have to dock it because it is still a microtransaction game, but the things you can buy are purely cosmetic and don't change the overall feel.  THAT IS HOW IT SHOULD BE DONE!Do I recommend it though?  Well, if you like a simple game that you can pick up and play without having to learn a whole textbook of rules, then you really can't get much simpler and classic than pool.  So yes, I do recommend this one for any pool enthusiast or casual gamer.  I'd even recommend it to the hardcore gamers who may need a break from their edgy games.
